Awesome utility. Here are a few things I've learned from trial and error

-If font color doesn't work, use a background image. 
-Background image should be a PNG or JPG file in the native resolution of your screen and have a simple one word filename. Filenames with spaces and large files seem to give it trouble.
-Very few fonts have the line draw characters to make it look good. Source Code Pro looks a little sharper than default. Bold and italic fonts sometimes give it trouble.
-Make sure to click Save and then File -> Install to MBR when you're done.
Great app to edit grub settings.
Very easy to use.
You can modify the GRUB easily with this program, all in a few clicks.
summary: A very easy to use GRUB editor

description: On my laptop Grub Customizer works as it should, since I use the to MBR reformatted data HDD rather then the GPT system SSD for the Grub bootmenue, so 'Install to MBR' works. On my desktop computer with all GPT disks I use it for customizing and saving the Grub configuration files. For generating the Grub bootmenu I then have to use terminal command sudo grub-mkconfig -o /boot/grub/grub.cfg to finish the job, since 'Install to MBR' doesn't (not in my case anyway). Still, great app.
summary: Very useful app, thank you for supplying it

description: It saves somewhere my settings, but it doesn't reflect boot menu.

It wouldn't launch from the Application Launcher Icon it installed.

But it would run from terminal. 

So I edited the icon. Under "Advanced tab" I clicked "Run in terminal" when I click the icon it opens in terminal, prompts me for SU passwd. Once I authenticate, it DOES launch the gui program as it should and runs perfectly.

Great little program.
it is grate and working well super well you gotta use today. only get if you have grub menu tho

I have a multiboot syst in my pc (w10 ,kubuntu22 and linux lite 5.8). Somehow I made a mistake and lost some files that prevented my pc to start properly with linux lite 5.8 : I attempted fixing it with Grub Customizer there (inside lite) but it didn't work ,however I just fixed it by editing a menu entry with same program (Grub cust) but, running it within Kubuntu 22. Don't ask me why or how, it happened to me before,on a similar situation. Fact is now starts up fine.
just sad not in official repo

Not that editing GRUB should be difficult, but reading documentation once was. At a time when you could not find many well-written resources for editing GRUB, this was when I began using this app. Today it is easy to learn how to edit GRUB, but GRUB Customizer does yet more. You can set an background image for you boot screen.
Easy to use, thanks to the creator!
summary: Easier to use than commands to modify boot order

Auch wenn man das Repository manuell hinzufügen muss, lohnt sich das für den Grub Customizer. Ich nutze ihn schon seit längerem für ein Dual-Boot-Setup mit Windows 10.

Bei einer Insallation von Linux (Debian) ist dieser Bootmanager ideal.
Da Windoof nach den Updates öfter auch einen Neustart verlangt um seine Updates abzuschliessen, kann leicht auf "letzten Booteintrag" eingestellt werden.
Vorteil: 
Man muss den Grub-Bootvergang nicht abwarten für um das Windoof erneut auszuwählen.
Auch die Dauer oder Anderes ist leicht zu ändern.
